meanings.definition: A person or thing that is an alternative to something else, but is superior or more advanced.
meanings.sent1: In the competition, the robot was a superalterns to the outdated model.
meanings.sent2: The new smartphone is a superalterns to the old one.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's sidekick was a superalterns in training.
meanings.sent4: The electric car was a superalterns speeding past the gas guzzlers.
meanings.sent5: The genius inventor was a superalterns in the world of technology.

meanings.definition: To provide an alternative that is superior or more advanced.
meanings.sent1: The company aims to superalterns traditional methods with innovative solutions.
meanings.sent2: She decided to superalterns the usual route with a shortcut.
meanings.sent3: The chef wanted to superalterns the boring menu with exciting dishes.
meanings.sent4: The artist sought to superalterns the conventional art style with a new approach.
meanings.sent5: He hoped to superalterns the outdated system with a modern one.
